pr_title: Issue #4923 - restore caching of SSLSession information for SSL Attributes

timeline.message:
Issue #4923 - restore caching of SSLSession information for SSL Attributes

Signed-off-by: Joakim Erdfelt <joakim.erdfelt@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Please rename the class to SslSessionData, and everywhere "info" to "data". Drop Cached.
Also make everything private: fields, methods, etc.
timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet

replies.author: joakime

timeline.bodyText: Keep field declarations in the same order as the constructor parameters and constructor assignments.
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.message:
Issue #4923 - Applying changes requested in PR

Signed-off-by: Joakim Erdfelt <joakim.erdfelt@gmail.com>

timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText: Isn't Integer better here so it doesn't get boxed on every get?
replies.author: gregw

replies.bodyText: Ah yes, Integer everywhere - I missed the boxing when returning the attribute, and the keySize values are not cached in Integer (only caches -128 to127).
replies.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: Put this getter after getKeySize() to be consistent with ordering.
timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet
sbordet

timeline.bodyText:
This method is the only user of SslSessionData.ATTR.
So perhaps we don't need the constant in another class.
We can do at beginning of method:
String key = SslSessionData.class.getName()
and then use key where now we use ATTR.
timeline.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText:
If the _keySize is an Integer then return that here so it doesn't get unboxed and reboxed.
Use int everywhere or Integer everywhere.
timeline.author: gregw

timeline.message:
